title: Watford 1-3 Manchester City: Bernardo Silva sends Man City top
description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy praises the "phenomenal" Bernardo Silva who scored twice in Manchester City's 3-1 Premier League win over Watford at Vicarage Road that sent the defending champions to the top of the league.

title: 'You give a referee, that has match fixed before, the biggest game in Germany, what do you expect?'
description: Borussia Dortmund midfielder Jude Bellingham questions the appointment of Felix Zwayer as the referee for his side's 3-2 defeat by Bayern Munich.

title: 'It will be anyone's to grab' - Arsenal and Chelsea meet in Women's FA Cup final
description: The Women's Super League's top two sides meet in the delayed 2020-21 FA Cup final, as leaders Arsenal face Chelsea at Wembley on Sunday.

title: Why Ugandan troops have entered DR Congo - again
description: Previous incursions have led to accusations of looting and abuse, so will it be different this time?

title: 'Highest standard' thrills Guardiola as Silva hits two to send Man City top for first time this season
description: Reigning champions Manchester City move top of the Premier League for the first time this season with a dominant win over Watford.

title: Football fans clap in tribute to Arthur
description: Saturday's match between Birmingham City and Millwall paused at the six minute mark so fans could pay tribute.

title: Covid: Met reviews Labour MPs' complaint over No 10 party claims
description: The London force says it does not routinely investigate "retrospective breaches" of Covid regulations.

title: Covid: GPs can defer some services in booster jab push
description: England's GPs can delay routine health checks for over-75s if clinically appropriate, NHS chiefs say.

title: Arthur Labinjo-Hughes: Football fans to clap for murdered Arthur
description: Arthur Labinjo-Hughes' stepmother and his father were both jailed on Friday for his death.

title: ICYMI: Jumping into an active volcano, and other ways to spend the festive season
description: Jumping into an active volcano is just one way to spend the festive season, in news you may have missed this week.

title: Arthur Labinjo-Hughes: What were the opportunities missed to save him?
description: Social services are facing questions about their actions before Arthur Labinjo-Hughes was killed.

title: Storm Arwen: Northern Powergrid sorry for power cut communication
description: The electricity supplier for the North East says it could have been better at talking to customers.

title: Michigan school shooting: Suspect's parents arrested in Detroit
description: The Michigan couple went on the run after being charged with involuntary manslaughter.

title: 'Rock star' pandas - not exactly a love story
description: They arrived like rock stars 10 years ago and their love life has been the source of endless speculation.

title: Patel makes cricket history with 10 wicket haul
description: Ajaz Patel becomes only the third bowler in Test history to take all 10 wickets in an innings as New Zealand bowl India out for 325 in the second Test.

title: Rare turtle washes up on UK beach 4,000 miles from home
description: Tally the Turtle is recovering in a UK zoo awaiting a flight back to the warm waters of Mexico.

title: Covid-19: Mums who were severely ill urge pregnant women to get jabs
description: In a video, one woman says her family were told she would not survive after giving birth with Covid.

title: FA Cup: Buxton striker Diego de Girolamo dreaming of FA Cup glory against Morecambe
description: Buxton striker Diego de Girolamo, who juggles playing non-league football with a job as a tiler, speaks to BBC Sport before his team's FA Cup second-round tie with Morecambe.

title: Russia Ukraine: Biden warns Russia against Ukraine 'red lines'
description: Intelligence officials fear Russia could invade Ukraine as soon as early 2022, US media reports.

title: The Papers: Omicron 'red alert', and Arthur failings probe
description: Several of Saturday's papers lead with scientists' warnings over the latest coronavirus variant.

title: Fraud: 'I had £18,000 stolen after my drink was spiked'
description: Fraudsters appear to be adopting the "sinister" tactic of spiking drinks to steal money, campaigners warn.

title: Will the Conservatives hold on to traditionally-safe North Shropshire seat?
description: The BBC's Jonathan Blake talks to voters in the West Midlands constituency ahead of the by-election.

title: Weakest Link: Romesh Ranganathan 'not trying to emulate' Anne Robinson
description: Comedian Romesh Ranganathan is set to host a rebooted version of the BBC One quiz show.

title: Ready for power: Team Scholz promises a new Germany
description: Next week will see a handover of power from the Merkel era and this is what to expect.

title: Saudi Arabia Grand Prix: A race for equal rights
description: As F1 races in Saudi Arabia, can it be a positive thing for female and LGBT rights?

title: Parag Agrawal: Why Indian-born CEOs dominate Silicon Valley
description: Parag Agrawal, Twitter's new CEO, is the latest of several Indian-Americans leading global tech firms.

title: Week in pictures: 27 November - 3 December 2021
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

title: Anti-Semitism: 2021 likely to be 'the worst year on record'
description: BBC journalist Tom Brada, who happens to be British and Jewish, investigates what's going on.

title: Ros Atkins on… America’s abortion divide
description: How abortion rights in the US look likely to be changed by a conservative majority Supreme Court.
